column2: qŭóniam bonus

column1: 2 ^ Dicant qŭi redèmpti sunt a Dòmino

column3: ^ Let them say so that have been redeemed by the Lord
column4: whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy.

column2: a solis ortu et occásu

column2: in inaqŭóso~; viam civitátis habitáculi non invenérunt. ^ They wandered in a wilderness
column3: in a place without water~; they found not the way of a city for their habitation.

column1: 5 ^ Esurièntes et sițièntes~; ánima eórum in ìpsîs defécit. ^ They were hungry and thirsty~; their soul fainted in them.
6 ^ Et clamavérunt ad Dòminum qŭum tribularèntur
column2: et de necessitátibus eórum erìpuit eos. ^ And they cried to the Lord when in affliction
column3: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

column1: 7 ^ Et dedúxit eos in viam rectam
column2: ut irent in civitátem habitațiónis. ^ And he led them into the right way
column3: that they might go to a city of habitation.

column2: et mirabìlia ejus fíliîs hòminum
column3: ^ Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him
column4: and his wonderful works to the children of men

column2: et ánimam esurièntem sațiávit bonîs. ^ for he hath satisfied the empty soul
column3: and hath filled the hungry soul with good things.

column1: 10 ^ Sedèntes in tènebrîs et ùmbra mortis~; vinctos in mendicitáte et ferro
column2: ^ Those seated in darkness
column3: and in the shadow of death~; bound in want and in iron

column2: et consìlium Altìssimi irritavérunt
column3: ^ because they had exasperated the words of God
column4: and provoked the counsel of the most High

column1: 12 ^ et humiliátum est in labóribus cor eórum~; infirmáti sunt
column2: nec fuit qŭi adjuváret. ^ and their heart was humbled with labours~; they were weakened
column3: and there was none to help them.

column1: 13 ^ Et clamavérunt ad Dòminum qŭum tribularèntur
column2: et de necessitátibus eórum liberávit eos. ^ Then they cried to the Lord when in affliction
column3: and he delivered them out of their distresses.

column1: 14 ^ Et edúxit eos de tènebrîs et ùmbra mortis
column2: et vìncula eórum dirúpit. ^ And he brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death
column3: and broke their bonds in sunder.

column2: et mirabìlia ejus fíliîs hòminum. ^ Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him

column2: et vectes fèrreos confréǧit. ^ Because he hath broken gates of brass

column1: 17 ^ Suscépit eos de via iniqŭitátis eórum~; pròpter injustìțias ènim suas humiliáti sunt. ^ He took them out of the way of their iniquity~; for they were brought low for their injustices.
18 ^ Omnem escam abomináta est ánima eórum
column2: et appropinqŭavérunt usqŭe ad portas mortis. ^ Their soul abhorred all manner of meat
column3: and they drew nigh even to the gates of death.

column1: 19 ^ Et clamavérunt ad Dòminum qŭum tribularèntur
column2: et de necessitátibus eórum liberávit eos. ^ And they cried to the Lord in their affliction

column2: et sanávit eos

column2: et mirabìlia ejus fíliîs hòminum. ^ Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him

column2: et adnúnțient ópera ejus in exsultațióne. ^ And let them sacrifice the sacrifice of praise

column2: facièntes operațiónem in aqŭîs mùltîs
column3: ^ They that go down to the sea in ships

column2: et mirabìlia ejus in profùndo. ^ these have seen the works of the Lord

column2: et stètit spíritus procèllaĕ
column3: et exaltáti sunt fluctûs ejus. ^ He spoke

column2: et descèndunt usqŭe ad abìssos~; ánima eórum in malîs tabescébat. ^ They mount up to the heavens

column2: et moti sunt sicut ébrius
column3: et òmnis sapiènția eórum devoráta est. ^ They were troubled

column1: 28 ^ Et clamavérunt ad Dòminum qŭum tribularèntur
column2: et de necessitátibus eórum edúxit eos. ^ And they cried to the Lord in their affliction
column3: and he brought them out of their distresses.

column1: 29 ^ Et statúvit procèllam ejus in aŭram
column2: et siluérunt fluctûs ejus. ^ And he turned the storm into a breeze

column2: et dedúxit eos in portum voluntátis eórum. ^ And they rejoiced because they were still
column3: and he brought them to the haven which they wished for.

column2: et mirabìlia ejus fíliîs hòminum. ^ Let the mercies of the Lord give glory to him
column3: and his wonderful works to the children of men.

column2: et in catédra seniórum laŭdent eum. ^ Let them exalt him in the church of the people

column1: 33 ^ Pósuit flúmina in desèrtum et èxitûs aqŭárum in sìtim
column2: ^ He hath turned rivers into a wilderness and the sources of waters into dry ground
a malìția inhabitántium in ea. ^ a fruitful land into barrenness
column3: for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

column2: et terram sine aqŭa in èxitûs aqŭárum. ^ He hath turned a wilderness into pools of waters
column3: and a dry land into water springs.

column2: et constituvérunt civitátem habitațiónis. ^ And hath placed there the hungry~; and they established a city for their habitation.
et plantavérunt víneas
column3: et fecérunt fructum nativitátis. ^ And they sowed fields
column5: and they yielded fruit of birth.

column2: et multiplicáti sunt nìmis

column2: et vexáti sunt a tribulațióne malórum et dolóre. ^ And they were brought to be few

column2: et erráre fecit eos in ìnvio

column2: et laĕtabùntur
